channel.title: vintage on The ol' tealeg ruminates
channel.description: Recent content in vintage on The ol' tealeg ruminates

item.title: Project Greyhound: My Granddad's camera
item.description: How this began A year or so ago, whilst I was visiting England on a business trip I took the time to go down and visit my parents. During this visit my dad indulged my interest in old cameras by digging out a few of his own old cameras and a couple of his fathers. The oldest two in this group were a Kodak Number 2 Brownie, in very good order, and an extremely battered looking Ensign Greyhound folding camera.

item.title: Voigtländer Vitomatic II
item.description: I’ve purchased one of these on E-bay for the princely sum of 20€. This is essentially the same as the Voigtlaender Vito CL I have been using recently but with a coupled rangefinder and with the meter mirrored in the viewfinder. Ebay listing suggests it’s fully functional, and given the classic West-German build quality of these late 1950s / early 1960s Voigtländers I have high hopes. To date I haven’t really found the “perfect” 35mm camera.
